io.spine.core

Interface EventContextMixin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EnrichableMessageContext, io.spine.core.EventContextOrBuilder, io.spine.validate.FieldAwareMessage, com.google.protobuf.Message, io.spine.base.MessageContext, com.google.protobuf.MessageLite, com.google.protobuf.MessageLiteOrBuilder, com.google.protobuf.MessageOrBuilder, java.io.Serializable, io.spine.base.SerializableMessage

    @Immutable
public interface EventContextMixin
extends EnrichableMessageContext, io.spine.core.EventContextOrBuilder, io.spine.validate.FieldAwareMessage
    Mixin interface for EventContexts.

    • Method Detail

      • actorContext

        default io.spine.core.ActorContext actorContext()
        Obtains an actor context for the event context.

        The context is obtained by traversing the events origin for a valid context source. There can be three sources for the actor context:

        1. The command context set as the event origin.
        2. The command context of an event which is an origin of this event.
        3. The import context if the event is imported to an aggregate.

        If at some point the event origin is not set, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown as it contradicts the Spine validation rules. See EventContext proto declaration.

      • actor

        default io.spine.core.UserId actor()
        Obtains the actor user ID.

        The 'actor' is the user responsible for producing the given event.

        It is obtained as follows:

        • For the events generated from commands, the actor context is taken from the enclosing command context.
        • For the event react chain, the command context of the topmost event is used.
        • For the imported events, the separate import context contains information about an actor.

        If the given event context contains no origin, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown as it contradicts the Spine validation rules.

      • producer

        default java.lang.Object producer()
        Obtains the ID of the entity which produced the event.
